articles.headline: Xcel to Disclose Global Warming Risks
articles.snippet: The New York attorney general announced an agreement that would require Xcel Energy, a builder of coal-fired plants, to disclose to investors the financial risks of global warming.
articles.abstract: The New York attorney general announced an agreement that would require Xcel Energy, a builder of coal-fired plants, to disclose to investors the financial risks of global warming.
articles.lead_paragraph: ALBANY  One of the country’s largest builders of coal-fired power plants will give investors detailed warnings about the risks that global warming poses to its business under a deal with New York’s attorney general.

articles.headline: New Nikon Holds a Secret
articles.snippet: The Nikon D90 camera, arriving in stores next month, has the features and performance of a single-lens reflex, and can record high-definition video.
articles.abstract: The Nikon D90 camera, arriving in stores next month, has the features and performance of a single-lens reflex, and can record high-definition video.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you saw it just sitting there, you’d never guess that the new Nikon D90 is a mind-blowing, game-changing camera.

articles.headline: As Food Prices Soar, Brazil and Argentina React in Opposite Ways
articles.snippet: In Brazil, the government is encouraging farmers to produce more for export while prices are high. But Argentina is focused on encouraging farmers to sell more at home.
articles.abstract: In Brazil, the government is encouraging farmers to produce more for export while prices are high. But Argentina is focused on encouraging farmers to sell more at home.
articles.lead_paragraph: SÃO PAULO, Brazil  Luciano Alves planted beans, corn and grain on about 7,500 acres of his farm in southern Brazil last year. This year, he is planting 8,600 acres. And he credits Brazil’s president, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, with the increase.

articles.headline: For a New Political Age, a Self-Made Man
articles.snippet: Even before he entered public life, Barack Obama began honing his political, mental and emotional skills.
articles.abstract: Even before he entered public life, Barack Obama began honing his political, mental and emotional skills.
articles.lead_paragraph: DENVER  From the earliest days of his presidential campaign, those around Senator Barack Obama have heard the same mantra. He repeated it after he announced his candidacy and after debates, after victories and defeats.

articles.headline: U.S. to Ease Pressure Tactic Over Legal Help for Employees
articles.snippet: The Justice Department will roll back a set of rules that penalized companies if they insisted on paying employees’ legal fees or protecting their confidential communications with corporate lawyers.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department will roll back a set of rules that penalized companies if they insisted on paying employees’ legal fees or protecting their confidential communications with corporate lawyers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department on Thursday will roll back a controversial set of rules that penalized companies if they insisted on paying employees’ legal fees or protecting their confidential communications with corporate lawyers.

articles.headline: Industry Rethinks Moneymaking Software Practice
articles.snippet: Before they ship PCs to retailers like Best Buy, computer makers get paid hundreds of millions of dollars to load them up with lots of free software. For $30, Best Buy will get rid of it for you.
articles.abstract: Before they ship PCs to retailers like Best Buy, computer makers get paid hundreds of millions of dollars to load them up with lots of free software. For $30, Best Buy will get rid of it for you.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Before they ship PCs to retailers like Best Buy, computer makers load them up with lots of free software. For $30, Best Buy will get rid of it for you.

articles.headline: Russia Adopts Blustery Tone Set by Envoy
articles.snippet: Russia’s representative to NATO, Dmitri O. Rogozin, often derided for his forceful style, is now taken more seriously.
articles.abstract: Russia’s representative to NATO, Dmitri O. Rogozin, often derided for his forceful style, is now taken more seriously.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW  Here is one measure of the aggressive shift in Russian foreign policy in recent weeks: Dmitri O. Rogozin, Russia’s representative to NATO, a finger-wagging nationalist who hung a poster of Stalin in his new ambassadorial office, is not sounding so extreme any more.

articles.headline: Witnesses to Dream Speech See a New Hope
articles.snippet: At least five people who saw Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. at the March on Washington in 1963 traveled to the convention.
articles.abstract: At least five people who saw Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. at the March on Washington in 1963 traveled to the convention.
articles.lead_paragraph: DENVER  She figured this dream for dead so many decades ago.

articles.headline: Amgen Alters Anemia Drug Discounts
articles.snippet: The company is halting some pricing practices that critics say were contributing to overuse of its flagship anemia drug Aranesp at a time of mounting concerns about the product’s safety.
articles.abstract: The company is halting some pricing practices that critics say were contributing to overuse of its flagship anemia drug Aranesp at a time of mounting concerns about the product’s safety.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amgen is halting some pricing practices that critics say were contributing to overuse of its flagship anemia drug Aranesp at a time of mounting concerns about the product’s safety.

articles.headline: Obama Wins Nomination; Biden and Bill Clinton Rally Party
articles.snippet: A unanimous vote made Senator Barack Obama the first African-American to become a major party nominee for president.
articles.abstract: A unanimous vote made Senator Barack Obama the first African-American to become a major party nominee for president.
articles.lead_paragraph: DENVER — Barack Hussein Obama, a freshman senator who defeated the first family of Democratic Party politics with a call for a fundamentally new course in politics, was nominated by his party on Wednesday to be the 44th president of the United States.

articles.headline: Economic Growth Revised Higher
articles.snippet: Gross domestic product increased at a 3.3 percent annual rate in the quarter, the government said.
articles.abstract: Gross domestic product increased at a 3.3 percent annual rate in the quarter, the government said.
articles.lead_paragraph: The economy expanded at a 3.3 percent rate from April through June, far faster than first thought, the government said on Thursday. But the outlook for the remainder of the year remained grim.
